alert.note: Alert for Chester; Montgomery; Philadelphia (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:59AM EST until January 11 at 5:18AM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Schuylkill River At Norristown affecting Philadelphia, Montgomery and Chester Counties. For the Schuylkill River...including Norristown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Schuylkill River at Norristown. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 12.5 feet, Flooding occurs in West Norriton. The West Indian Lane bridge begins to flood. At 13.0 feet, Water begins to cover and close Riverview Boulevard in West Norriton. At 15.0 feet, River Road in West Conshohocken begins to flood. The lower garages at the Riverview Landing and the Lofts at Valley Forge start to take on water. The lower section of Port Indian Road in West Norriton becomes impassable. At 16.0 feet, The Upper Merion Boathouse starts to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 15.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:30 AM EST Wednesday was 16.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage just after midnight tonight and continue falling to 12.2 feet Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 15.9 feet on 12/18/2023. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (1 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Stg Time Date Schuylkill River Norristown 13.0 15.6 Wed 10 a 11.6 10.3 Crested & Falling &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued this evening at 1100 PM EST.
